page.title: 01Car Colston and environs
page.content: Latterly Car Colston has largely become a commutor villiage with expensive houses, but Screveton and Hawksworth remain principally farming villages. The ususal materials are brick and pantile and both Brunsell Hall and Beech clos are seventeenth century Grade II listed buildings. Car Colstons Little Green and nearby grass paddocks and coverts support abundant wildlife but the predominant land use is arable farm land cropping winter cereals and oil seed rape. Wooda are mainly deciduous, and several are newly planted, Ash is the predominant hedgerow tree and numerous streams drain into the Car Dyke. Older established families include Blagg (1743) Gilbert Martin Thurman and in ScrevetonMarsh and Willis.(Blacksmiths).
